New Records: The winning margin of 309 runs is the largest ever at a Menâ€™s Cricket World Cup and the second largest ever in ODIs.
Bas de Leede conceded 115 runs from his ten overs, the most expensive figures in ODI history.
Glenn Maxwell clubbed a century off only 40 balls for Australia, the fastest-ever hundred seen at a Cricket World Cup.
Adam Zampa returned the best figures after the pace-bowling unit had dismantled the top order, with the spinner finishing with figures of 4/8 from three overs.
Key Match Events: Warner and Steve Smith helped Australia make a strong start after opting to bat, with the duo helping post 66/1 after the first powerplay.
Glenn Maxwell demolishing the Netherlands attack with a brutal display of hitting, registering by far the fastest-ever hundred seen at a Cricket World Cup.
Netherlands unravelled against a buoyant Australian bowling attack, who rattled through the batting line-up in just 21 overs.
Bas de Leede fared the worst of the Dutch bowlers, conceding 115 runs from his ten overs, the most expensive figures in ODI history.
Pre-Game Insights: Australia opted to bat first after captain Pat Cummins won the toss.
Netherlands opted to stick with the same XI that succumbed to Sri Lanka on Saturday.
Post-Match Reflections: The record margin of defeat gives Australia an enormous net run rate boost as they strengthen their grip on a top-four spot in the standings.
Captain Scott Edwards was left stranded at the close on 12*, and will look to pick his players back up after the most bruising of encounters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Australian top order kicked on after that strong start to set up a large total, with Warner (104) forging solid partnerships with Smith (71) and Marnus Labuschagne (62).
Australia set Netherlands a target of 400 runs in their clash at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
The Dutch started with spin right from the start after being asked to bowl first, with Aryan Dutt, the off-spinner, opening the bowling.
Others: Glenn Maxwell became the top wicket-taker at the tournament so far with his haul of 4/8 from three overs.
Cameron Green took his place in the side after Marcus Stoinis was ruled out due to a calf problem.
Travis Head was not included in the XI after arriving in India earlier in the week.
